alert.note: Alert for Cabell; Lincoln; Putnam; Wayne (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 19 at 6:10PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong showers impacting portions of Boyd, Lawrence, central Meigs, Gallia, Lawrence, Mason, Cabell, northwestern Putnam, northwestern Lincoln, northwestern Jackson, Wayne and southwestern Wood Counties through 645 PM EST... At 609 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong showers along a line extending from Rutland to near Blaine. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Sporadic gusty winds in and near these and other showers in the area could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Huntington, Ashland, Ironton, Point Pleasant, Gallipolis, Ripley, Louisa, Coal Grove, Pomeroy, Wayne, Rio Grande, Chesapeake, Racine, Proctorville, Rutland, Blaine, Beech Fork State Park, Cannonsburg, Lake Vesuvius and Forked Run State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 138 and 169. Interstate 64 in Kentucky between mile markers 181 and 191. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 34. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
